data.title: GlamourGals Foundation
data.text:
Empowering intergenerational connections

GlamourGals teen volunteers are lifting the burden of social isolation experienced by senior residents in care nationwide.

Together we can create more connected communities

TEEN VOLUNTEERS CHAPTERS + SUSTAINED IMPACT

Since 2000, our program has impacted two generations. Senior residents in care feel a renewed sense of community and self-worth.

Teen volunteers gain essential leadership skills demonstrating empathy and compassion through our intergenerational programming.

#GGMOVEMENT

Fostering compassionate leaders

The GlamourGals program fosters essential leadership skills.

ORGANIZATION

Each chapter is led by an all volunteer leadership team that engages directly with senior centers, recruits new members and schedules activities in their local community.

COMMUNICATION

From training new volunteers to working with seniors and staff, our GG leaders are connecting with new people and building up confidence to lead.

EMPATHY

Our teen volunteers trade stories with seniors during visits. This helps increase our volunteers’ emotional intelligence, and understand the humanity and beauty in others.

INTERGENERATIONAL IMPACT

High School & College chapters across the country serving seniors in care.

Teen volunteers reflect in online journals.

10,000

105

COMMUNITIES

JOURNALS

100,000

30,000

For 24 years, we've connected volunteers and senior homes.

ALUMNI

GG has created a movementof compassionate leaders.

CONNECTIONS

I had so much fun today because it wasn’t just about doing her nails; it was about allowing her to have the freedom to talk for as long as she wanted.

-Maggie, GG Volunteer

OUR FOUNDER

Rachel Doyle

A visionary founder with a passion for fostering intergenerational connections while developing essential leadership skills among young women.

GlamourGals is an organization built on the power of human connection.

Loretta E. Lynch, 83rd United States Attorney General
